content: Jesus left the temple  and was going on His way when His disciples came up to Him to call His attention to the [magnificent and massive] buildings of the temple.

While Jesus was seated on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, and said, “Tell us, when will this [destruction of the temple] take place, and what will be the sign of Your coming, and of the end (completion, consummation) of the age?”

Jesus answered,  [deceiving you and leading you into error].  [misusing it, and appropriating the strength of the name which belongs to Me],   [of the age].   [of the intolerable anguish and the time of unprecedented trouble]. [endure]   [by their association with Me]  [from the One whom they should trust]  [handing over believers to their persecutors]     [under suffering]   [the gospel]  [of the age]

[the appalling sacrilege that astonishes and makes desolate],   [for refuge].  [because there will not be enough time].    [from persecution and suffering]  [when Jewish laws prohibit travel].  [again].  [of tribulation]   [during the great tribulation],     [of a house],’   [in glory]  [everyone will see Him clearly].
[coming in His glory]  [and especially Israel]  [regretting their rebellion and rejection of the Messiah],  [in brilliance and splendor].
[taking place],   [the people living when these signs and events begin]   [as now known]  [exact]  [in His humanity],    [very]   [unexpected judgment].  [for judgment]   [for judgment]

[give strict attention, be cautious and active in faith],  [whether near or far]    [who follow Me]  [in the house]   [faithful]    [he will not return for a long while],’    [over sorrow and pain]  [over distress and anger].
